name: State_16

timeline_beats.label: League of Rivermouths founded (regional maritime confederation)
Centralization into a mercantile maritime state

factions.label: Merchant Guilds
factions.influence_hint: dominant in law, trade policy, and reagent import contracts

factions.label: Tide-Seers
factions.influence_hint: ritual navigators with cultural sway over voyages

factions.label: Dockworkers' Syndicate
factions.influence_hint: labor power over quays, periodic strike capability

factions.label: Foreign Trade Houses
factions.influence_hint: external capital and control of scarce reagents

traits: maritime orientation and seasonal navigation calendar
pragmatic syncretism in belief and law

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
Long-range mind influence is rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries exist but cannot replace charts and seamanship
Combustion-derived industry limited (no high-pressure steam megatechs)
Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents or specialized burg-labors
Maritime dependence: ports vulnerable to blockade; reagent supply lines critical
Must honor obligations of alliance A3 (Inner-Coastal Accord)
notes: Strategic chokepoints: Inner Docklands drydock and Cape of Lores batteries
Seasonal monsoon/navigation windows constrain long voyages and trade cycles
Smuggling and reagent black market centered in Outer Isles and Northern Estuary
Tide-Seers control key voyage rites; Merchant Guilds fund reagent imports
Limited heavy industry; major projects require imported combustible fuels or external partners
